thread.title: Unbeaten Locust Grove visits Henry County
thread.title_full: Unbeaten Locust Grove visits Henry County

author: Neighbor Newspapers (noreply@neighbornewspapers.com)
title: Unbeaten Locust Grove visits Henry County
text: by Bill Baldowski Neighbor Newspapers October 23, 2015 04:49 PM | 138 views | 0 | | Even though Locust Grove (7-0, 5-0) stands atop the AAAA, subregion 4 football standings as its only undefeated team, head coach Clint Satterfield still has concerns as his team heads into Friday’s subregion encounter at Henry County (4-3, 4-2).Offensively, the coach said his squad needs to convert plays when given the chance as well as get his rushing attack, “back into gear.” “We struggled with our ground game,” he said as the Wildcats experienced their smallest margin of victory thus far this year, a 28-21 home win over Eagle’s Landing.Henry County head football coach Morris Starr also had offensive problems last week as Eastside halted the Warhawks’ four-game win streak with a 32-16 win at Eastside.Since the start of the season, Locust Grove has scored 250 points, an average of 38 points a game, while allowing opponents 91, or 13 points a contest, which included consecutive shutouts of Pike County and Mt. Zion.Although Henry County has yet to shutout an opponent, it has limited three teams, Mt. Zion, Pike County and Hampton, to eight points or less in winning each of those games handedly.Thus far this season, the Warhawks’ have scored 193 points, an average of 28 points a game, while allowing opponents 158, or 23 points a gameDespite a concern for his offense, Satterfield’s team is averaging about 354 yards in total offense per game while Henry County is averaging about 350, Starr said.Locust Grove junior running back Caleb Huntley continues to lead the team’s rushing attack as, through six games, he had compiled 863 yards on 79 carries, just over 10 yards a carry.Henry County’s ground attack is led by its senior quarterback, Dominique Joseph, who has gained more than 450 yards on 60 attempts, or about eight yards a carry.Joseph also leads the Warhawk aerial game with 400 yards passing on 55 completions.Locust Grove senior quarterback Cameron Maddox is 56-of-95 passing for 844 yards and eight touchdowns.With two games remaining in the regular season, Henry County is seated fourth in the subregion directly behind Jonesboro (7-1, 5-1) and Spalding (6-1, 4-1).Satterfield said his team has got to remained focused on Henry County and be ready for a physical encounter in an unfriendly atmosphere.“We can’t be worried about being undefeated or who has to beat who as this is an important subregion matchup against a very capable and well-coached foe.” Share This Article | similar stories
